data.title: Wendy and DB
data.text:
​Wendy and DB have pioneered a blues-inspired space in children’s music. They explore themes of freedom, love, self-worth, creativity, and curiosity through folklore, stories, and songs. Wendy and DB pair their voices with ukulele, percussion, and guitars to bring high-energy music to every performance!

​

“Wendy and DB have fashioned a fantastic follow-up to their 2023 Grammy-nominated album Into The Little Blue House. Back Home builds upon the bluesy mood of Blue House on its 15 excellent tracks, which are full of down-home charm and thoughtful messages. The album overflows with uplifting lyrics that urge listeners (young and old alike) to believe in yourself, to work for a better tomorrow, and the importance of freedom." ~NAPPA

​

Songwriters Credits:

Tracks 1, 2, 6, 8, 9 and 14 by Wendy Morgan and Darryl “DB” Boggs

Track 5 “Boxes and Labels” Poem by Wendy Morgan

Tracks 12 “Watching The River Flow” by Bob Dylan

Track 4 “Moving Mountains” Wendy Morgan Lyrics Kenny "Beedy Eyes” Smith, Roosevelt Hatter Purifoy and Mike Wheeler

Track 7 “Hum Away” Wendy Morgan and Libby Rae Watson: Music and Lyrics

Track 3 “Come to your senses” and #10 “Move them bones” Wendy Morgan

Doug MacLeod Music and Lyrics

Track 11 “Friends” Wendy Morgan Lyrics Darryl Boggs and Doug MacLeod Music

Track 13 “BE YOU-Walk to your own beat” Wendy Morgan Lyrics and Music, Music Sharde Thomas and Chris Mallory (Rising Stars Fife and Drums)

Production/Musicians/Recording:

Produced by Michael Freeman and Wendy Morgan

Co-produced by Darryl Boggs and Kenny “Beedy Eyes” Smith

Recorded at: Archer Recording, Memphis TN; Wire Recording, Austin TX.

Clarksdale Recording, Clarksdale, MS., Joyride Studio, VSOP Studios, and Tone Zone Recording, Chicago, IL

Engineers: Roger Heiss, Mic Wilson, Stuart Sullivan, Ty Caughell, Blaise Barton,

Brian Leach

Mixed at: Tone Zone Recording Chicago, IL by Roger Heiss & Michael Freeman

Mastered by Paul Blakemore, Nashville, TN

Wendy Morgan: Lead & Back-up vocals All tracks accept 8 and 10

Darryl Boggs: Guitar, Lead & Back-up vocals All tracks accept 6, 9, 10, 13, 14.

Michael Freeman: Chajchas, Track 10

Ruthie Foster: Vocals and Guitar, Track 1

Sharde Thomas/Chris Mallory: Rising Stars Fife and Drums, Track 2 and 13

Libby Rae Watson: Vocals &: Resonator, Tracks 7 and 12

William Steber: Blues Harp Track 11

Doug MacLeod: Vocals & Guitar, Tracks 3, 10 and 12.

Kenny “Beedy Eyes” Smith: Drums/Percussion Tracks 4, 8, 9 and 14

Mike Wheeler: Acoustic and 12 String Guitar, Tracks 4, 6, 8, 9 and 14.

Brian Quinn: Upright Bass, Tracks, 6, 8, 9 and 14

Roosevelt Hatter Purifoy: Electric Piano, Tracks 4, 8, 9, and 14.

Anne Harris: Violin, Tracks 1 and 14

Billy Branch: Harmonica, Tracks 4 and 9

Stacy McMichael: Bass, Tracks 4 and 13

Rich Rankin: Phone sounds Track 2

*HHW Choir Voices: Keishun Woods, Stacey Morillon, Illeanne Celilio, Carlos Perales

**Young Voices: Christina Floros, Tyree Phelps, Demari “Chico” Wheeler

Thank you and we love you Mick Kolassa for your hospitality and for providing rehearsal space in Memphis! PM Woodwinds Evanston, IL for Chicago rehearsal space.

Our amazing team: Jeremiah Ketner smallandround.com, Kristen Fescoe Director of ideas and marketing, Sandra Kratc, Light at My Window, boots on the ground PR, Audio and Video assistance and David Box Video and Animation and Elizabeth Waldman PR, Tyler Morgan Krol Video production, drone footage and social media assistance Charles Needham, editor, roadie, cameraman and all around good guy!

Album description: “Back Home” is an album with songs dedicated to self-love and freedom and is a follow-up to Wendy and DB’s successful, 2023 Grammy Nominated Album, “Into The Little Blue House”. “Back Home” is a collection of acoustic performances celebrating traditional blues roots music through originally crafted songs for young souls and anyone who enjoys learning about blues and its traditions.
